term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - supercritical drying of a gel
term.title: supercritical drying of a gel

item.text: Drying of a gel using a supercritical fluid.

notes.item: Since liquid and vapour are indistinguishable in a supercritical fluid, there is no capillary pressure to cause shrinkage and cracking of the pores formed in the gel.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 1801. 'Definitions of terms relating to the structure and processing of sols, gels, networks, and inorganic-organic hybrid materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2007)' on page 1826 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779101801)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
